title: Perth Mint's Sept gold sales double, silver sales hit 3-1/2-year peak
text:
© Reuters. Perth Mint's Sept gold sales double, silver sales hit 3-1/2-year peak

Oct 1 (Reuters) - The Perth Mint's gold sales more than doubled in September from a month earlier, the refiner said on Tuesday, while silver product sales rose to their highest in three-and-a-half years.

Sales of gold coins and minted bars in September climbed 115% to 46,837 ounces, its highest since November 2018.

Meanwhile, silver coin sales rose 15.3% to 1,350,038 ounces, a peak since March 2016, the mint said in a blog post

Benchmark spot gold prices marked their first decline in five months in September. However, they have gained nearly 14% so far this year. GOL/

The Perth Mint refines more than 90% of newly mined gold in Australia, the world's second-largest gold producer after China.
